bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Allen Hines was born 25 March 1756 in Surry County, Virginia. He moved to Sussex County, Virginia, where he married first Frances Williams (d. by 1790), 16 October 1772, and they had at least five children. He married second Judith Parker (d. 1840) 3 February 1791, and they had at least two children. Hines moved his family to Franklin County, North Carolina, in 1805. He died there in 1836.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Papers, 1836-1985, of Allen Hines of Franklin County, North Carolina, consisting of: a) will, dated 28 January 1826, of Allen Hines; b) will, dated 22 June 1836 and proved September 1840, of Judith Hines of Franklin County and widow of Allen Hines; c) doctor's bill, 2 April 1839, from Dr. Willie Perry of Franklin County, to Joel Harris, executor of Allen Hines for payment for visits to Hines from 1830 to 1834; d) petition, 1841, from the heirs of Hines to the Court of Equity asking that his property left to them be sold and the proceeds divided; e) note and account, dated 1840 or 1843, listing the hire of slaves for five months beginning 1 January 1840 by the estate of Allen Hines; and f) genealogical notes, 1985, on Hines and his children.
